Isaiah or Isaias__02.1: The word that Isaias the son of Amos saw, concerning Juda and Jerusalem.
Isaiah or Isaias__02.2: And in <u>the last days</u> the mountain of the house of the Lord shall be prepared <u>on the top of mountains</u>, and it shall be exalted above the hills, and all nations shall flow unto it.
Isaiah or Isaias__02.3: And many people shall go, and say: Come and let us go up to the mountain of the Lord, and to the house of the God of Jacob, and he will teach us his ways, and we will walk in his paths: for the law shall come forth from Sion, and the word of the Lord from Jerusalem.
Isaiah or Isaias__02.4: And he shall judge the Gentiles, and rebuke many people: and they shall turn their swords into ploughshares, and their spears into sickles: nation shall not lift up sword against nation, neither shall they be exercised any more to war.
Isaiah or Isaias__02.5: O house of Jacob, come ye, and let us walk in the light of the Lord.
Isaiah or Isaias__02.6: For thou hast cast off thy people, the house of Jacob: because they are filled as in times past, and have had soothsayers as the Philistines, and have adhered to strange children.
Isaiah or Isaias__02.7: Their land is filled with silver and gold: and there is no end of their treasures.
Isaiah or Isaias__02.8: And their land is filled with horses: and their chariots are innumerable. Their land also is full of idols: they have adored the work of their own hands, which their own fingers have made.
Isaiah or Isaias__02.9: And man hath bowed himself down, and man hath been debased: therefore forgive them not.
Isaiah or Isaias__02.10: Enter thou into the rock, and hide thee in the pit from the face of the fear of the Lord, and from the glory of his majesty.
Isaiah or Isaias__02.11: The lofty eyes of man are humbled, and the haughtiness of men shall be made to stoop: and the Lord alone shall be exalted in that day.
Isaiah or Isaias__02.12: Because the day of the Lord of hosts shall be upon every one that is proud and highminded, and upon every one that is arrogant, and he shall be humbled.
Isaiah or Isaias__02.13: And upon all the tall and lofty cedars of Libanus, and upon all the oaks of Basan.
Isaiah or Isaias__02.14: And upon all the high mountains, and upon all the elevated hills.
Isaiah or Isaias__02.15: And upon every high tower, and every fenced wall.
Isaiah or Isaias__02.16: And upon all the ships of Tharsis, and upon all that is fair to behold.
Isaiah or Isaias__02.17: And the loftiness of men shall be bowed down, and the haughtiness of men shall be humbled, and the Lord alone shall be exalted in that day.
Isaiah or Isaias__02.19: And they shall go into the holes of rocks, and into the caves of the earth from the face of the fear of the Lord, and from the glory of his majesty, when he shall rise up to strike the earth.
Isaiah or Isaias__02.20: In that day a man shall cast away his idols of silver, and his idols of gold, which he had made for himself to adore, moles and bats.
Isaiah or Isaias__02.21: And he shall go into the clefts of rocks, and into the holes of stones from the face of the fear of the Lord, and from the glory of his majesty, when he shall rise up to strike the earth.
Isaiah or Isaias__02.22: Cease ye therefore from the man, whose breath is in his nostrils, for he is reputed high.
